concept-wr.title: Resource Scaling (Autoscaling)
concept-wr.shortdesc: You can use Heat to reassign stack resources automatically to meet changing conditions.

conbody.p: You can define and monitor performance thresholds for metrics such as CPU activity, and then add or remove resources when the thresholds are crossed. This allows you to make efficient use of the hardware in the cluster, by allocating resources only when they are needed, and assigning them where they are most required.
HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade supports two types of scaling:

dd.p: This type of scaling (also known as horizontal scaling) adds or removes instances as needed.
This type of scaling (also known as vertical scaling) increases or decreases resources (for example, vCPUs) for individual instances as needed. For more about up/down scaling, see .

conbody.p: Performance metrics can be collected and reported by the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade platform, or by the guests using guest metrics.
